description: The Entrepreneurship Club provides a platform for students to develop their business ideas, connect with mentors, and participate in startup competitions. Members gain hands-on experience pitching ideas and building business plans.
activities: Annual Business Plan Competition with $10,000 in prizes
Weekly startup workshops and mentor sessions
Field trips to local startups and incubators

description: FBLA prepares students for careers in business through academic competitions, leadership development, and educational programs. Members build networking skills and professional connections.

The Robotics Team designs, builds, and competes with robots in national competitions. Members apply mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and programming skills while working in interdisciplinary teams.
activities: Annual participation in the FIRST Robotics Competition
Robot demonstration events for local schools

description: SAE gives students experience designing, building, and testing vehicles for competition. Projects include formula-style race cars, off-road vehicles, and electric vehicles.
The Student Art Collective organizes art shows, community art projects, and field trips to museums and galleries. Members have opportunities to exhibit their work and build a professional portfolio.
The Animation Guild focuses on digital and traditional animation techniques. Members collaborate on short films, share skills, and learn industry-standard animation software.
The Biology Club engages students in field research, laboratory experiences, and conservation projects. Members develop practical skills while building connections within the scientific community.
Pre-Health Professionals supports students preparing for careers in healthcare. The club provides information about application processes, standardized tests, and healthcare career options.
